definition: to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise

sentences.english: After the quarrel she gave her boyfriend the gate.
sentences.chinese: 吵嘴後她和男朋友一刀兩斷了。

sentences.english: The two friends wrangled and now they don ' t speak to each other.
sentences.chinese: 那對好朋友吵嘴了，到現在還彼此還不說話呢。

sentences.english: We make love again that evening, our row long forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我們又做了一次，吵嘴的事就算過去了。

sentences.english: Disagreements are inevitable in any relationship.
sentences.chinese: 吵嘴在情侶關係中很常見。

sentences.english: It is very foolish that people quarrel because of some unnecessary things.
sentences.chinese: 爲了一些沒必要的事情吵嘴，就更傻了。

sentences.english: He's been avoiding me since our quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 自從我們上次吵嘴後，他一直躲着我。

sentences.english: I went to them silently and asked the reasons.
sentences.chinese: 我毫無慍色的走到他們身邊，詢問吵嘴的原由。

sentences.english: We bicker with each other, we love working with each other.
sentences.chinese: 我們互相吵嘴，我們很喜歡和對方合作。

definition: to quarrel/to have a row/quarrel/CL:頓|顿[dun4]
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to make a lot of noise/to be disorderly
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
